contentrichtext.text: {|{{Infobox Ship Begin}} {{Infobox Ship Image |Ship image= [[Image:USSS11SS116.jpg|300px|USS S-11 (SS-116)]] |Ship caption= }} {{Infobox Ship Career |Hide header= |Ship country= |Ship flag= {{USN flag|1945}} |Ship name= USS ''S-11'' |Ship namesake= |Ship ordered= |Ship builder= [[Portsmouth Naval Shipyard|Portsmouth Navy Yard]] |Ship laid down= 2 December 1919 |Ship launched= 7 February 1921 |Ship acquired= |Ship commissioned= 11 January 1923 |Ship decommissioned= 2 May 1945 |Ship in service= |Ship out of service= |Ship struck= |Ship reinstated= |Ship homeport= |Ship motto= |Ship nickname= |Ship honours= |Ship fate= Sold for scrap |Ship status= |Ship notes= }} {{Infobox Ship Characteristics |Hide header= |Header caption= |Ship class= [[United States S class submarine|S-class]] [[submarine]] |Ship displacement= {{convert|876|LT|t|0|abbr=on}} surfaced<br />{{convert|1092|LT|t|0|abbr=on}} submerged |Ship length= {{convert|231|ft|m|abbr=on}} |Ship beam= {{convert|21|ft|10|in|m|abbr=on}} |Ship draft= {{convert|13|ft|1|in|m|abbr=on}} |Ship propulsion= |Ship speed= {{convert|15|kn|mph km/h|lk=in}} surfaced<br />{{convert|11|kn|mph km/h}} submerged |Ship range= |Ship test depth= |Ship complement=42 officers and men |Ship sensors= |Ship EW= |Ship armament=• 1 × {{convert|4|in|mm|0|abbr=on}} [[deck gun]]<br />• 5 × {{convert|21|in|mm|0|abbr=on}} [[torpedo tube]]s |Ship armor= |Ship notes= }} |} '''USS ''S-11'' (SS-116)''' was a second-group (''S-3'' or "Government") [[United States S class submarine|''S''-class submarine]] of the [[United States Navy]]. Her keel was laid down on 2 December 1919 by the [[Portsmouth Navy Yard]]. She was [[ship naming and launching|launched]] on 7 February 1921 sponsored by Miss [[Anna E. Roosevelt]] and [[ship commissioning|commissioned]] on 11 January 1923 with Lieutenant Wilder D. Baker in command. Supplementing duties along the northeast coast, ''S-11'' visited [[Guantánamo Bay, Cuba|Guantanamo]], [[Cuba]], in 1923, and [[Saint Thomas, United States Virgin Islands]], [[Trinidad]], and [[Coco Solo]] in 1924. Sailing from [[New London, Connecticut]], on 29 September, via the [[Panama Canal]] and [[California]], she visited [[Hawaii]] from 27 April to 25 May 1925, before returning to New London on 12 July. ''S-11'' operated in the [[Panama Canal]] area from January through April 1926, visited [[Kingston, Jamaica]], from 20 March to 28 March 1927, and served again in the [[Panama Canal]] area from February into April 1928. From 1929 into 1936, ''S-11'' operated almost exclusively in the [[Panama Canal]] area, but was in Miami Florida, on 31 March 1930 and visited [[Washington, DC]], from 15 May to 5 June 1933. From at least 30 June 1929 until at least 7 August 1931, Commanding officer was V.R. Murphy. Departing Coco Solo on 13 June 1936, ''S-11'' arrived at [[Philadelphia, Pennsylvania]], on 22 June, and was decommissioned there on 30 September. ''S-11'' was recommissioned on 6 September 1940 at Philadelphia. After voyages from New London to Philadelphia, [[Bermuda]], and St. Thomas in 1941, ''S-11'' arrived at the [[Coco Solo]] submarine base in the [[Panama Canal Zone]], on 5 October that year. ''S-11'' served in the [[Panama Canal]] area from then into June 1943, and next at Trinidad into February 1944. Following overhaul in the [[Panama Canal]] area, ''S-11'' sailed in July via [[Aruba]] to [[Trinidad]], where she operated into October. Arriving at [[Guantanamo Bay Naval Base|Guantanamo Bay]] on 26 October, she served there into January 1945. After a voyage to the [[Panama Canal]] area, she sailed from there on 8 February, arrived at New London on 24 February, and at Philadelphia on 28 March. ''S-11'' was decommissioned on 2 May of that year at Philadelphia and was struck from the [[Naval Vessel Register]]. She was sold on 28 October 1945 to [[Rosoff Brothers]] of [[New York City]]. Resold to [[Northern Metals]] Company of [[Philadelphia, Pennsylvania]], on an unspecified date, she was scrapped. == References == {{DANFS}} {{United_States_S_class_submarine}} {{DEFAULTSORT:S-11 (SS-116)}} [[Category:Ships built in Maine]] [[Category:United States S-class submarines|S-11]] [[Category:World War II submarines of the United States]] [[Category:1921 ships]]
